item.description:
Do you love that Obama poster 'HOPE' that looks almost like pop art? That was created by designer Shepard Fairey whose work will be on exhibit at the ICA in Boston from Feb. 6 - August 16. His work is engaging, sometimes guerilla style street art (OBEY stickers), and many times a cultural commentary.

museum site
http://www.icaboston....
http://www.icaboston....

his site
http://obeygiant.com/...

Let's meet at the Providence train station and ride up there â€“ approx. $15 round trip. We can have lunch in Chinatown or the North end near Haymarket or closer to the museum on the waterfront. If there are at least 10 of us, we can get a group rate of $10 per person for the museum.

After the museum, you are on your own to hang out in Boston and ride the train home at your leisure. I'll post the Saturday train schedule when it gets closer. But want to get some rsvps to see if we can secure the group self-guided tour at the museum.
item.how_to_find_us: Meet you at the Providence Train Station
item.name: Lunch and Exhibit at the ICA in Boston
